title: Cheesy Salisbury Steak for a Crowd

Directions.1: Mix ground beef and eggs together in a very large bowl.

Directions.2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat; stir in bell peppers and onion. Cook and stir until vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes.

Directions.3: Add cooked vegetables, Cheddar cheese, panko, Worcestershire sauce, steak sauce, ketchup, salt, pepper, and garlic powder to the beef mixture; mix until well combined.

Directions.4: Pinch off a piece of the meat mixture and form it into a quarter-sized patty. Fry it in the same skillet until done, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Taste and adjust seasonings to remaining mixture, if needed.

Directions.5: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.6: Form meat mixture into 25 equal-sized patties. Brown several patties at a time in the skillet, being careful not to burn them, 3 to 5 minutes per batch. Transfer patties to baking sheets.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, 10 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 155 degrees F (63 degrees C).
